gurmukhi: ਨਹਿ ਤੱਤ੍ਰ ਥਲੀ ਸਤ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਰਹੇ ॥ ਜਲ ਜੰਤ ਪਰੱਤ੍ਰਣ ਪਤ੍ਰ ਦਹੇ ॥੩੬੨॥
transliteration: Nah(i) Tattra Thalisat Pattra Rahe|| Jal Jant Parattran Patra Dahe||362||
translation: Even there the leaves of lotus could not survive and the creatures of water, grass, leaves etc. all were reduced to ashes with the geat of the state of separation of Ram.362.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤ ਢੂੰਢ ਬਨੇ ਰਘੁਨਾਥ ਫਿਰੇ ॥ ੳੁਤ ਰਾਵਨ ਅਾਨ ਜਟਾਯੁ ਘਿਰੇ ॥
transliteration: It Dhoondh Bade Raghounaath Phire|| Out Raavan Aan Jataayu Ghire||
translation: On this side Ram was roaming in the forest in search of Sita, on the other side Ravana was surrounded by Jatayu.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਛੋਰ ਹਠੀ ਪਗ ਦੁਅੈ ਨ ਭਜਯੋ ॥ ੳੁਡ ਪੱਛ ਗੲੇ ਪੈ ਨ ਪੱਛ ਤਜਯੋ ॥੩੬੩॥
transliteration: Ran Chhodh Hathipag Duai Na Bhajyo|| Ud Pachchh Gad Pain A Pachchh Tajyo||363||
translation: The persistent Jatayu did not yield in its fierce fighting even though its wings were chopped.363.

gurmukhi: ਪਛਰਾਜ ਰਾਵਨ ਮਾਰਿ ਕੈ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਸੀਤਹਿ ਲੈ ਗਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Pachhraaj Raavan Daar(i) Kai Raghuraaj Seetah(i) Lai Gado||
translation: Ravana took away Sita after killing Jatayu,

gurmukhi: ਨਭਿ ਓਰ ਖੋਰ ਨਿਹਾਰਕੈ ਸੁ ਜਟਾੳੁ ਸੀਅ ਸੰਦੇਸ ਦਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Nabh(i) Khor Nihaar-kai Su Jataau Seea Sandes Dayo||
translation: This message was communicated by Jatayu, when Ram saw towards the sky.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਜਾਨ ਰਾਮ ਗੲੇ ਬਲੀ ਸੀਅ ਸੱਤ ਰਾਵਨ ਹੀ ਹਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Tah Jaan Raam Gad Baliseea Satt Raavan Hidaree||
translation: On meeting Jatayu Ram came to know for certain that Ravana had abducted Sita.

gurmukhi: ਹਨਵੰਤ ਮਾਰਗ ਮੋ ਮਿਲੇ ਤਬ ਮਿੱਤ੍ਰਤਾ ਤਾ ਸੋਂ ਕਰੀ ॥੩੬੪॥
transliteration: Hanvant Maarag Mo Mile Tab Mittrataa Taa Son Daree||364||
translation: Roaming on the paths (of the forest) Ram met Hanuman and they both became friends.364.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਅਾਨ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਕੇ ਕਪਿਰਾਜ ਪਾੲਿਨ ਡਾਰਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Tin Aan Sriraghuraaj Ke Kapiraaj Paain Ddaryo||
translation: Hanuman brought Sugriva the king of monkeys to fall at the feet of Ram.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਬੈਠ ਗੈਠ ੲਿਕੈਠ ਹ੍ਵੈ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਚਾਰਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Tin Baith Gadth Ikaith Hvai Eh Bhaant(i) Mantra Bichdaryo||
translation: And all of them unitedly held consultation amongst themselves,

gurmukhi: ਕਪ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰ ਸਧੀਰ ਕੇ ਭਟ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਬੀਰ ਬਿਚਾਰਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Kap Beer Dheer Sagheer Ke Bhat Mantra Beer Beechaar-kai||
translation: All the ministers sat down and gave their personal views.

gurmukhi: ਅਪਨਾੲਿ ਸੁਗ੍ਵਿ ਕੳੁ ਚਲੁ ਕਪਿਰਾਜ ਬਾਲ ਸੰਘਾਰ ਕੈ ॥੩੬੫॥
transliteration: Apnaae Sougriv Kau Chal(u) Kapiraaj Baal Sanhar Kai||365||
translation: Ram killed Bali, the king of monkeys and made Sugriva his permanent ally.365.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਬਾਲ ਬਧਹ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤਮ ॥੮॥
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Baal Badhah Dhiaae Samaaptam||8||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled Killing of Bali’ in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begins the description of sending of Hanuman in search of Sita :
